$schema: FindSkills Design System — Complete AI Development Guide
$authority: This file is the ONLY design specification source for AI-driven development. All UI implementations MUST comply strictly. No ad-hoc values, no external style systems, no creative improvisation.

designPrinciples.P1_ClarityOverDecoration: Information hierarchy must be scannable in 3 seconds. Remove anything that does not serve comprehension.
designPrinciples.P2_BrandFirstContrast: Use strong neutral contrast for structure; apply coral (#FF9667) exclusively as the action/accent signal.
designPrinciples.P3_SystemicConsistency: Only use tokens defined in this file. Never introduce raw hex, pixel, or font values in component code.
designPrinciples.P4_BalancedWarmth: Layouts should be rational and spacious. Warmth comes solely from the brand accent, not from decoration.
designPrinciples.P5_AccessibleByDefault: Body text contrast ≥ 4.5:1, large text ≥ 3:1, interactive elements ≥ 3:1 (WCAG AA).
designPrinciples.P6_SinglePrimaryAction: Each viewport should have at most ONE primary (brand-filled) action button. All others must be secondary or ghost.
designPrinciples.P7_ProgressiveDisclosure: Show only what the user needs now. Use modals, dropdowns, and expandable sections to defer complexity.

forbiddenPatterns: Neon glows, gradient text, or animated gradient backgrounds
Heavy drop shadows, colored shadows, or layered dramatic shadows
Inline styles with raw pixel/hex values — always use Tailwind tokens
Any color not defined in this file's color section
Compact/dense interaction modes — always use comfortable density

technology.styling: Tailwind CSS v3 (classes only, no CSS-in-JS, no inline styles)

color._usage: All colors MUST be referenced via their Tailwind token. The hex values are listed for documentation only.

primary.usage: Primary CTA backgrounds, active indicators, accent icons

deep.usage: High-contrast text on brand-tinted backgrounds (e.g. Featured badge text)

tint10.usage: Subtle brand backgrounds — active nav items, icon containers, featured badges

surface.usage: Page canvas, section fills, hover states for secondary buttons

elevated.usage: Cards, modals, navigation bar, input backgrounds

textPrimary.usage: Headings, body text, primary button text on brand bg

textSecondary.usage: Supporting text, table cell text, alert body text

textTertiary.usage: Placeholder, captions, disabled text, breadcrumb inactive items

border.usage: Card borders, input borders, button outlines, dividers between nav items

divider.usage: Horizontal rules, table row separators, section dividers

success.usage: Positive states — active badges, success alerts, upward trends

warning.usage: Caution states — pending badges, warning alerts

danger.usage: Negative states — error alerts, failed badges, destructive buttons, notification dots

info.usage: Informational states — info alerts, info badges, neutral progress bars

typography._fontStack: font-sans → Inter, SF Pro Text, PingFang SC, Helvetica Neue, Arial, sans-serif
typography._monoStack: font-mono → JetBrains Mono, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, monospace

rules.headingToBodyGap: mt-1 (8px) for subtitle after heading, mt-2 (16px) for body paragraph after heading
rules.maxBodyWidth: max-w-prose (720px) for readable body text columns
rules.minInteractiveText: text-body-sm (14px) — never use caption for clickable labels
rules.sectionTitlePattern: text-h2 + text-body-md subtitle with mt-1 gap, mb-3 before content

spacing._grid: 8px base unit. All spacing values are multiples of 4px.

elementGap.usage: Form field spacing, alert item gap, button group gap

componentPadding.usage: Inner padding of inputs, alert banners, table cells, dropdown items

cardPadding.usage: Card interior, nav bar interior, section containers

blockGap.usage: Gap between cards in grid, between subsections

sectionGap.usage: Main content vertical rhythm between major sections

none.usage: Never for UI components; reserved for full-bleed images

sm.usage: Checkbox corners, inline code blocks, spacing-vis bars

md.usage: DEFAULT for most components: buttons, inputs, nav items, badges, alerts, table status pills, dropdown menus, icon containers

lg.usage: Cards, modals, table containers, elevated panels, empty state containers

full.usage: Avatars, toggle switches, progress bar tracks and fills, notification dots, spinners

sm.usage: Cards at rest, nav bar, toggle knob

focusBrand.usage: Focus ring for inputs and interactive elements

fast.usage: Button hover/active, input focus, dropdown item hover, nav item hover

rules: All interactive elements must have transition classes
Use transition-colors for bg/text changes, transition-shadow for focus/elevation, transition-all for combined
Never chain more than 2 sequential animations

levels.name: Page
levels.description: Top-level canvas: nav + main + footer. One per route.

levels.name: Section
levels.description: Major functional block separated by <hr> dividers and space-y-8 gaps.

levels.name: Module
levels.description: Reusable chunk: card grid, table with toolbar, form group.

levels.name: Component
levels.description: Single UI unit: button, input, badge, table row, alert.

levels.name: Element
levels.description: Atomic part: icon, label, helper text, divider, avatar.

rules: Max ONE primary action button per viewport section
Headline MUST precede body content in every section
Group related elements by proximity and alignment
Max 3 visual priority tiers per section (heading → body → meta)

governance.tokenPolicy: NEVER use raw hex, pixel, or font values in component code. Always use Tailwind classes mapped from this file.
governance.newComponentProcess: Define the component spec in this file FIRST, then implement. Never implement then document.
complianceChecklist: Uses ONLY typography classes from this file's scale
Uses ONLY spacing tokens from this file's scale
Uses ONLY colors defined in this file
All interactive elements have proper transition classes
Hover states use defined hover tokens
Icons are from lucide-react with correct size/strokeWidth
Max one primary button per viewport
governance.versionControl: Increment $version for any change. All downstream UI must be re-validated after version bump.
